episode_summary: This episode features facts about Viking grooming habits, a peculiar letter exchange between early U.S. presidents, Steinway pianos being parachuted into WWII battlefields, and the filming of E.T. with a focus on Drew Barrymore's interactions with the animatronic alien.

facts.fact: Viking men dyed their hair blonde, wore makeup, and had grooming kits.
The fourth president of the United States once sent the third president of the United States a letter giving the precise measurement between a weasel's anus and its vulva.
During the Second World War, Steinway parachuted pianos into battlefields.
When filming E.T., Steven Spielberg kept E.T.'s puppeteers on the clock at lunchtime so that six-year-old Drew Barrymore could eat with him so she kept believing he was real.
